intro: Tillandsia virescens var. sanzinii, commonly known as the Sanzini’s green tillandsia, is a species of air plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its dense, rosette-shaped foliage that is typically covered in a thick layer of white, woolly trichomes. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks. Its leaves are usually a vibrant green, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of white or pale pink. This variety is popular among epiphytic plant enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
